actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to eliminate cost-of-living pay adjustments for Members of Congress, to provide that recommendations of the President with respect to salaries of Members of Congress shall take effect only after approval by the Congress.

summary.text: Amends the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 to abolish automatic cost-of-living pay adjustments for Members of Congress. Amends the Federal Salary Act of 1967 to make the recommendations of the President with respect to salaries of Members of Congress effective only upon a resolution by the Congress approving such recommendations.

titles.title: A bill to eliminate cost-of-living pay adjustments for Members of Congress, to provide that recommendations of the President with respect to salaries of Members of Congress shall take effect only after approval by the Congress.
